h:div.h:p: The word phenotype is used with many different meanings, including ‘the observable traits of an organism’. In medicine, the word can be used with at least two different meanings. It is used to refer to some observed deviation from normal morphology, physiology, or behavior. In contrast, the disease is a diagnosis, i.e., and inference or hypothesis about the cause underlying the observed phenotypic abnormalities.

description.value: This profile stipulates that a FHIR Condition must have a codeable concept that represents the disease. The concepts can be taken from various ontologies, but for rare-disease concepts, we recommend MONDO.
